name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: The fight to save Uighur culture is well underway in the diaspora—and it's being led by chefs, poets, singers, filmmakers, language teachers, and musicians. 

My latest: https://t.co/sreEYZd4uz

name: TheAtlantic
text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “McConnell could try other options, such as replacing Lee and Tillis on the Judiciary Committee, or bypassing the panel entirely, but each of those would require majority votes on the Senate floor that he might struggle to win.” https://t.co/6GWj8nb1D6

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @russellberman: Democrats can't stop Amy Coney Barrett's nomination to the Supreme Court. But will the virus? https://t.co/hO1NAwqZ9E

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: NEW: For the moment, COVID-19 diagnoses have jeopardized three votes that Republicans can't afford to lose in their fight to get Amy Coney Barrett onto the Supreme Court, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/memA5eE9HZ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JohnGHendy: Big: According to Congressional procedure, if Lee and Tillis aren't physically present to achieve a quorum, Democrats could boycott the Amy Coney Barrett hearing and block the vote. 

More: https://t.co/3wiusK01o0 via @russellberman

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: Why do we have the impulse to tell whoever’s closest when major news breaks? @julieebeck reports: https://t.co/lsZq2tITX2

text: RT @AdrienneLaF: A strange and fascinating piece by @sarahzhang about remdesivir, the experimental antiviral that the president is taking. https://t.co/AExwuuuZtv

text:
RT @amywilentz: Here’s my piece on @realDonaldTrump and his recent diagnosis:

https://t.co/Ysm741NeoG

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SwatiGauri: "The geopolitical order hangs in the balance, waiting for incremental updates on Trump’s pulmonary function." @jameshamblin helps us understand with the little information we have:  https://t.co/SP6xJtHt7S

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @SwatiGauri: "During the pandemic, I have not lived like the president. Instead of wearing a mask over my eyes, I’ve confronted the reality of the virus, and worn it where it needs to be worn...

I don’t shake hands with anyone. Do you?" https://t.co/T3IEQT39Rr

name: TheAtlantic
text: In “Praying on a 707,” published in The Atlantic in 1972, Anne Sexton describes trying to talk to God as she ascends into the clouds on an airplane: https://t.co/nT1psflMQ9

name: TheAtlantic
text: How do you protect a culture from being wiped out? For Uighurs living outside of China, this is more than just a hypothetical, writes @YasmeenSerhan. It's the key to ensuring that their heritage will be passed on to future generations. https://t.co/iWUF3yXbpB

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: Given Trump's age, gender, and weight, an ICU visit would not be surprising. But given the variable nature of the disease, neither would a Monday discharge. @jameshamblin 

https://t.co/FSHR3zhFcq https://t.co/M8La1zV9Jj

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SwatiGauri: "Republicans, however, now face a more complicated path to a Supreme Court confirmation, one imperiled by their own laxity toward the pandemic." From @russellberman:  https://t.co/F8cRjrrwkH

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: The Uighur diaspora is faced with the task of "preserving and promoting their identity in countries where few people might know who the Uighurs are, let alone what the world stands to lose should their language, food, art, and traditions be eradicated." https://t.co/ucdtgj43Rg

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: I know there’s _a lot_ of news right now, but if you’d like a change of pace, this week, we released #TheFirsts—a series of profiles of the first Black students to desegregate America’s schools. https://t.co/cn6ianQkVw

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Is [Trump] still able to discharge the office from Walter Reed? If he’s not, U.S. law provides remedies. Either way, Americans and the world need to know," @davidfrum writes: https://t.co/HqylGLeHvY

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump has destroyed our trust with wanton abandon—trust in our political system, trust in our institutions, trust in science, trust in America itself—simply because it benefits him, personally, to do so," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/wDEdnpkpAL

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump's COVID-19 diagnosis in the final weeks of the 2020 election puts Mike Pence under a microscope, @mckaycoppins writes: https://t.co/anWXysa1m9

name: TheAtlantic
text: Mira Kafantaris’s husband woke her up in the middle of the night to tell her Trump had COVID-19. Why do we have the impulse to tell whoever’s closest when major news breaks? @julieebeck reports: https://t.co/K1O98PQNe7

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Dick Johnson Is Dead” is made up of scenes in which the filmmaker’s father dies in shocking ways. @davidlsims on the strangeness of watching the documentary during a pandemic and its ultimately hopeful message: https://t.co/LKPh8N9QBo

name: TheAtlantic
text: Catching the coronavirus certainly didn't hurt Jair Bolsonaro politically—and how he spun it might reveal some lessons for Donald Trump, @realcpaz reports. https://t.co/95exWzBBUU

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "If a language and culture are inherited by an enough number of children, it won’t be in danger." https://t.co/ucdtgjlEIO

text: RT @GrahamDavidA: Trump was willing to gamble even with the health and lives of his closest aides and donors. Why would anyone believe he has their best interests at heart?https://t.co/My0b5FQYMz

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @Susan_Hennessey: This is a piece I never imagined I'd write. With @qjurecic, on the narrow, reluctant case for court-packing and why, if Republicans continue the smash-and-grab approach to confirming Barrett, it may be the only way for Democrats to save the Court. https://t.co/f8vMsXCi3G

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "When I asked Mahmut whether she felt she could more freely enjoy her culture outside the Uighur homeland, she said she could never be truly free while speaking out against abuses by the Chinese government." https://t.co/ucdtgj43Rg

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @jameshamblin: I’m hesitant to read into Trump‘s medications anything about the severity of his disease. 
Dexamethasone is only recommended for serious cases. But Trump has been known to go against scientific evidence and guidelines. 

https://t.co/WMONmicbxE https://t.co/MXSRkDgF5R

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "[T]he aim of China’s actions in Xinjiang is clear: to homogenize Uighurs into the country’s Han Chinese majority, even if that means erasing their cultural and religious identity for good. What is taking place is a cultural genocide." -- @YasmeenSerhan:
https://t.co/rLr5fWegdj

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @beccarosen: .@qjurecic and @Susan_Hennessey have long been skeptical of court packing, but seeing the Republicans race to replace RBG before the election has changed their minds. Read their carefully considered case for court packing: https://t.co/GPj4nK983r

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @qjurecic: W/ @Susan_Hennessey: The dangerous rush to confirm Amy Coney Barrett underlines the Republican power grab at play. If Barrett is confirmed and Trump loses reelection, Democrats should pack the Court. https://t.co/I3yY5WDIqV

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The president apparently took no measures to protect his political advisers, aides, and donors, and largely left them in the dark once he had tested positive," @DavidAGraham writes: https://t.co/ui9TGXregq

name: TheAtlantic
text: When Kyle Newell reopened his New Jersey gym, he just wanted to save his business and support his family. But online reopening advocates seized on his moment of crisis, writes @wiczipedia: https://t.co/j2u38hBDFY

name: TheAtlantic
text: Books about Jimi Hendrix, the Sex Pistols, Joy Division, and more in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From @latham_tori: https://t.co/lltPmAWjJE

name: TheAtlantic
text: Frederick K. Brewington’s education came at the end of a bitter civil-rights battle that engulfed New York state, more than a decade after 'Brown v. Board of Education.' One of five pieces from our special project #TheFirsts, by @AdamHSays: https://t.co/Dyukpz2rX3

name: TheAtlantic
text: The factors that have bolstered the need for international observers in the upcoming U.S. election are the same ones that have made their job more difficult, @YasmeenSerhan reports: https://t.co/fl2XLlTkMT
